content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
This problem is a solid C++ exercise for learning string manipulation, conditionals, and character classification. It helps practice using standard library functions like std::isalpha and std::tolower, while handling edge cases like non-letter characters. The case-insensitive vowel check teaches normalization logic, and the straightforward yet effective transformation logic makes it a great way to solidify basic programming skills. It’s simple enough for beginners but still relevant for real-world text processing tasks

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Very quick and simple challenge, nice for a CoC

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Fast fun and easy.

Fast, fun and easy.
Approved. If you have time, check mine :-) 
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/1241280a725ae09459cf17b049df1d88e25e8f
and 
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/1246892e5a6fdaad5903050adfab5fb3f20504
which is also talking of vowels :-)

Goal
* Please format "a", "e", "i", "o", "u", "Fizz" and "Buzz" as {{constants}}.

* Please remove the quotation marks around "Fizz" and "Buzz".

* Please change "numbers" to "digits".

Input
* Please format "s" as a [[variable]].

* Please delete "1 <= len(s) <= 100".

Output
* Please format "Fizz" and "Buzz" as {{constants}}.

* Please remove the quotation marks around "Fizz" and "Buzz".

Constraints
* Please delete the first two items. They are part of the task; they aren't constraints.

* Please change "|s|" to "length of [[s]]".

Cases
* Please change the following validators so that each validator and its corresponding test are similar and not the same:
   • Validator 3
   • Validator 4

Thanks.
I've removed the trailing newline from the output of Test 3.
